name: More Impossible Trivia for Bible Experts Quiz | Religion | 10 Questions

questions.text: About how many times is the word "Lord" mentioned in the King James Bible?
questions.explanation:
7,000 times.

	The word 'Lord' is not found in Esther, Song of Songs/Solomon, Titus or 1, 2, and 3 John. Of course, depending on the translation, this figure may differ slightly.  With diverse answers, however, this should not be a problem - a count of, say 5,538 in one translation is closer to the given answer than any other.

questions.text: According to Proverbs 30:1, who is credited with the wisdom of that chapter of Proverbs?
questions.explanation:
Agur.

	Proverbs 30:1 - "The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, his utterance. This man declared to Ithiel - to Ithiel and Ucal".

questions.text: Which two women had their ages recorded in the Bible?
questions.explanation:
Sarah and Anna.

	Genesis 23:1 - "Sarah lived one hundred and twenty-seven years; these were the years of the life of Sarah." Luke 2:36-37 - "Now there was one, Anna, a prophetess, the daughter of Phanule, of the tribe of Asher. She was of a great age, and had lived with a husband seven years from her virginity; and this woman was a widow of about eighty-four years, who did not depart from  the temple, but served God with fastings and prayers night and day."

questions.text: Which Bible personality set fire to 300 foxes' tails?
questions.explanation:
Samson.

	Judges 15:4 - "Then Samson went and caught three hundred foxes; and he took torches, turned the foxes tail to tail, and put a torch between each pair of foxes."

questions.text: Which of these pairs of books both mention cannibalism?
questions.explanation:
2 Kings and Lamentations.

	2 Kings 6:29 -"'So we boiled my son and ate him. And I said to her on the next day, "Give me your son, that we may eat him" but she has hidden her son [from us].'" Lamentations 4:10 - "The hands of the compassionate women have cooked their own children; they have become food for them in their destruction." Cannibalism also makes an appearance in Leviticus 26:29, Deuteronomy 28:53-57, Ezekiel 5:10 and Jeremiah 19:9.

questions.text: In what book of the Bible does it talk about stars singing?
questions.explanation:
Job.

	Job 38:7 - "When the morning stars sang together, and all the songs of God shouted for joy?"

questions.text: How many times is the word "the" used in the bible, KJV version?
questions.explanation:
over 20,000 times.

	This word is naturally the most-used word in the Bible.

questions.text: In Zechariah's vision, how wide was the flying scroll?
questions.explanation:
Ten cubits.

	Zechariah 5:2 - "And he said to me, 'What do you see?' So I answered, 'I see a flying scroll. Its length is twenty cubits and its width is ten cubits." Ten cubits is about fifteen feet.

questions.text: What Bible personality was called "the Tishbite"?
questions.explanation:
Elijah.

	1 Kings 17:1 - "And Elijah the Tishbite, of the inhabitants of Gilead, said to Ahab, 'As the Lord God of Israel lives, before whom I stand, there shall not be dew, nor rain these years, except at my word.'"
